text: Victor Lonzo Fleming (February 23, 1889 – January 6, 1949) was an American movie director, cinematographer, and producer. His most popular movie were The Wizard of Oz (1939), and Gone with the Wind (1939). He won an Academy Award for Best Directing in 1939. Fleming died of a heart attack while on his way to the hospital in Cottonwood, Arizona, aged 59. ==Other websites== * * * * The Real Rhett Butler – David Denby on Victor Fleming (The New Yorker) Category:1889 births Category:1949 deaths Category:Academy Award winning directors Category:American cinematographers Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Movie directors from California Category:Movie producers from California Category:People from Pasadena, California
title: Victor Fleming
